main.name: George Y Lee
main.description: studying Computer Science and Computer Engineering.
main.bio: George is an aspiring software and web developer studying Computer Science and Computer Engineering at Brown University. He has a deep passion for great food, video games, and of course, coding. George also loves traveling and has even been to South Africa for research on rhino dehorning
main.contactmessage: Please contact me if you're interested in hiring me, meeting me, or just chatting with me. I love meeting new people!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Brown University's open curriculum allows me to deepen my passion for Computer Science and Engineering as well as explore topics in English, Math, Chemistry, and Entrepreneurship. I keep busy by working on a variety of personal projects, attending hackathons, working on a Formula One Racing Car, and exploring the East Coast.

Throughout high school, I took 13 AP courses and was a valedictorian in a class of over 500 students. I Co-Founded and was Vice President of my school's robotics club, sang as a baritone for the CDMHS Madrigals choir, and competed in Shot Put and Discus. Every month, I would volunteer at the Discovery Cube OC and teach young children the wonders of science and technology. I also conducted breast cancer research at the University of California, Irvine, and studied the effects of dehorning rhinos at Mankwe Reserve in South Africa.

work.title: Software Researcher
work.description: Looking into semantic mapping for places identification with ROS.

work.title: Steering Subsystem Lead
work.description: Learned to  machine metal using mills and lathes. Created chain guard from scratch from designing the part on Solidworks to actual fabrication with a solid piece of stock. Leading steering subsystem.

cs0150.title: PAC-MAN
cs0150.category: Built from scratch using JavaFX. Created each components as distinct Java Classes and Interfaces. Had a graphical and logical 2D array for the graphics. Animated ghosts and score calculations with keyframs and timelines. Handled collisions with pellets, ghosts, energizers. Used breadth first search with the ghosts to have them chase PAC-MAN and added a random component so PAC-MAN isn't always being chased. PAC-MAN is controlled using arrow key inputs and event handlers.

cs0150.title: Tetris
cs0150.category: Built from scratch using JavaFX. Randomly generates pieces. Pieces are controlled using arrow keys and the space bar for quick drop. The blocks are abstracted to handle most of the logics of collisions. Also used keyframes and timelines for animations.

cs0150.title: Doodle Jump
cs0150.category: Built using JavaFX as a class project. Modeled the doodle falling by calculating the velocity and position of the doodle at each keyframe in the timeline. The black and green platforms trigger different velocity calculations. The doodles is controlled using keyboard inputs and event handlers.

cs0160.title: Seamcarve
cs0160.category: A program that determines the importance of pixels in an image and calculates what seams can be removed using arrays to store the importance of each of the pixels and the direction of where the pixel came from starting at the bottom of the image. Built using Java.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
